issue.title: FF loses tag change when closing inspector

labels.name: bug-browser-specific
labels.description: A bug that only appears in certain browsers

repository.name: iD
repository.description: ðŸ†” The easy-to-use OpenStreetMap editor in JavaScript.

issue.body:
If you add an additional tag, and leave focus in the value input, and close the inspector by clicking on the map to clear the selection, the tag addition is lost. Also, the tag autocomplete menu is stranded.

This happens on (at least) FF. Not Chrome though.

body: Related: #597, #1099.  Perhaps we can remove preventDefault and replace with a CSS solution for the zoom behaviour, too?
Although `*-user-select: none` is not supported by IE9, I believe `onselectstart` is.
Yes, according to #1099, this will solve the iframe issue too, which would be nice!

issue.title: Use user-select: none instead of preventDefault for drag/zoom.

repository.name: d3
repository.description: Bring data to life with SVG, Canvas and HTML. :bar_chart::chart_with_upwards_trend::tada:

issue.body:
We also suppress the selectstart event, as IE9 doesn't support user-select.

Fixes #1288, #1099.

Note: untested in IE9.  Only tested in Chrome so far.

issue.title: Restore preventDefault, but use tabindex to focus the parent element.

repository.name: d3
repository.description: Bring data to life with SVG, Canvas and HTML. :bar_chart::chart_with_upwards_trend::tada:

issue.body:
Work-in-progress. Supersedes #1322. Should fix #1321 #1288 #1099.

Tasks:
- [ ] Applying the drag behavior, zoom behavior or brush should set the tabindex attribute and outline style on the nearest HTML ancestor element (the ownerSVGElement when used within SVG, and the current element when used within HTML).
- [ ] If the tabindex attribute is already set, it should be preserved? What about the outline style? It might be safe to ignore this possibility.
- [x] The mousedown event should be cancelled (using preventDefault and stopPropagation).
- [x] The touchstart event should _not_ be cancelled for the drag behavior, as this disables draggable links. (Canceling mousedown does not prevent click, but canceling touchstart effectively does.)

issue.title: Use DOM event delegation for all layers

repository.name: Leaflet
repository.description: ðŸƒ JavaScript library for mobile-friendly interactive maps ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¦

issue.body:
Adds `Layer` `addInteractiveTarget` and `removeInteractiveTarget` that implements event magic for all layers using delegate events (propagated to map container and handled there in one place). No more mouse event code duplication, and it speeds up adding lots of markers significantly (no need to add tons of listeners on each individual element). Closes #46 

To Do:
- [x] test extensively to make sure nothing is broken
- [x] figure out how to pass marker latlng instead of mouse position in marker event data
- [x] add some tests
